title: Belize - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 29 January 2021, in the outskirts of Crooked Tree, Belize, the Belize police department and the Joint Intelligence Operation center seized a boat in Hill Bank lagoon. According to reports, moments earlier, a plane landed and caught fire and the occupants fled the scene and got into two boats. Police seized one boat and arrested nine men. A total of 2000 pounds of cocaine were seized. Two of the arrested people were police officers.

Around 26 January 2021 (month of), in San Ignacio, Cayo, a man was killed and his body was found decapitated off the Benque Viejo Road. According to reports, the body was in an advanced state of decomposition. 1 fatality.

On 19 December 2020, in Belize City, Belize, one man was killed and four were injured on Partridge Street Extension in a drive-by shooting. According to reports, at least one of the victims was targeted due to old gang-related rivalry. 1 fatality, 4 injured.

On 15 December 2020, in Belize City, Belize, the Minister of Health and Wellness established a curfew amid the coronavirus pandemic. The curfew for adults runs from 8 pm to 5 am. The curfew for children runs from 6 pm to 5 am. The estimated end date of the curfew is 2 March 2021.
On 14 December 2020, in Belize City, Belize, two men shot and killed a man on Ebony Street. According to reports, the victim was not the intended target of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 29 November 2020, in Trial Farm, Orange Walk, two men shot and killed a man. According to reports, the men showed up at the victim's house under the excuse of buying marijuana. Police believe this event could be drug-related. 1 fatality.

On 27 November 2020, in Belize City, Belize, the Minister of Health and Wellness established a curfew from 10 pm to 4:59 am, as part of a response to a coronavirus outbreak. Security personnel and essential workers with a special pass are allowed to move during the pandemic within the scope of their duties.
On 24 November 2020, in Belize City, Belize, three armed men shot and killed a man in the Holy Emmanuel Street area. 1 fatality.

On 24 November 2020, in Belize City, Belize, there was a battle in the streets in Saint Martin de Porres' area between alleged rival gangs. Police in riot gear were deployed. No fatalities or injuries reported.
On 18 November 2020, in Belize City, two men shot and killed a man in Lancaster Street. 1 fatality.
On 12 November 2020, in Belmopan, Belize, the new prime minister John Briceno affiliated to the People's United Party sworn in. The last party victory was in 2003.

On 2 November 2020, in Bella Vista and Santa Cruz, Belize, the National Oversight Committee of the Government of Belize established a curfew from 8 pm to 5 am, as part of a response to a coronavirus outbreak.

On 18 October 2020, in Red Bank, Stann Creek, supporters of the People's United Party clashed with supporters of the United Democratic Party. Some of them wielded machetes. Police officers had to fire two shots as a warning. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Belize (2008-2020) Prison Guards

On 12 October 2020, in Hattieville, Belize, 28 prisoners escaped from the Belize Central Prison. During the jailbreak, correctional officers clashed with the prisoners, who overpowered the officers at knifepoint. No fatalities nor injuries reported. [size= 28]
On 10 October 2020, in Belize City, Belize, a couple on a motorcycle shot and killed a man outside a bar. 1 fatality.
On 21 September 2020, in Santa Martha, Orange Walk District, police forces found and seized a crashed landed airplane used for drug trafficking.

On 15 September 2020, in Belmopan municipality, Cayo District, demonstrators burned tires to block a road in a demonstration against the Equal Opportunities Bill that will be presented to the House of Representatives. Several groups disagree with some of the values promoted in the bill that allegedly affect the set of moral standards in Belize. [size=no report]

On 15 September 2020, in Orange Walk Town municipality, Orange Walk, demonstrators burned tires to block a road in a demonstration against the Equal Opportunities Bill that is being presented to the House of Representatives. Several groups disagree with some of the values promoted in the bill that allegedly affect the set of moral standards in Belize. [size=no report]
On 7 September 2020, in Belize City, Belize, two armed men shot a man and a woman in a parked car in Fabers Road. The man died and the woman was injured. 1 fatality.
On 6 September 2020, in Belize City, Belize, two armed men shot dead a man in a yard on Mckay Boulevard. 1 fatality.

On 6 September 2020, in Santa Elena, Cayo District, a man on a motorcycle shot a woman in Carrillo Puerto Avenue in a drive-by shooting. The victim was injured. According to the police, the attack may be gang related since the house have been frequently visited by a member of the George Street Gang.
On 4 September 2020, in Hattieville, Belize District, an armed men shot a gang member inside a house. During the attack a woman was injured. 1 fatality.
On 2 September 2020, in Santa Elena, Cayo District, two men broke into a yard shared by two and shot dead two men, one in each house in the Trenchtown area. 2 fatalities.
On 24 August 2020, in Guinea Grass, Orange Walk District, residents demonstrated against coronavirus lockdown measures, and to demand assistance from the government. [size=no report]

On 18 August 2020, in San Pedro Town, Belize district, tourist guides and residents demonstrated in front of the municipality building to demand support from the local and national authorities to cope with coronavirus measures and its economic impact. [size=no report]
On 10 August 2020, in Belmopan, Cayo district, MS-13 members vandalized the Belmopan Nazarene Church, benches in the park and other structures in the city.
On 5 August 2020, in Mile 8, armed men driving a car shot dead a man. According to the report, the attack was gang related. 1 fatality.
On 22 July 2020, in Calcutta, Corozal District, a man driving a car was shot dead by two armed men driving a motorcycle. 1 fatality.

On 22 July 2020, in Carmelita, Orange Walk District, three men riding bicycles were attacked with machetes by three men. Two of the victims managed to escape, and the third one was chopped dead. 1 fatality.

On 22 July 2020, in Belize City, members of the Christian Workers' Union in the Port of Belize were dispersed by police forces during a peaceful protest aimed to discuss a cut in their salaries and the scheduled termination of 36 contracts by the Port of Belize company. The police fired rubber bullets and tear gas to the crowd of sitting protesters. Several protesters were severely injured. [size=no report]

On 20 July 2020, in San Ignacio, Cayo District, two armed men shot five men. Two men were killed and three were injured. According to the report, one person was targeted by the attack and the other people were just collateral victims. 2 fatalities.

On 15 July 2020, in Belize City, around 35 people protested against the opening of the Philip Goldson International Airport as a measure to activate the economy affected by the coronavirus crisis. The protesters claim that it is too soon to reopen the airport as the coronavirus pandemic has not even reach its peak in Belize. [size=around 35]
On 9 July 2020, in Belmopan, Belize, teachers and students staged a protest against budget cuts at the University of Belize. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2020, in Belize City, members and a multitude of supporters of the University of Belize Faculty and Staff Union (UBFSU) demonstrated against the decision by the University board and president to declare the school in a state of financial exigency. The demonstrators demand bargaining power and access to financial data about the economic contraction caused by the coronavirus crisis. [size=a multitude]

On 7 July 2020, in Belize City, the government declared the State of Emergency for Southside Belize City, to combat an abrupt increase in crime and violence. Around 300 policemen with the support of military forces conducted an operation were 100 suspected gang members were arrested.
On 28 May 2020, in Belmopan, Cayo district, a mini bus driver was shot dead by two men. 1 fatality.

On 28 May 2020, in Sarteneja, Corozal District, a crashed airplane was found by police forces that was being tracked from Venezuela to Belize. According to the authorities the airplane had a drug cargo that was not found in it. Two people have been arrested in the course of this investigation.
On 25 May 2020, in Belize City, several men attacked four men and stabbed them. According to the report, the attack is related to a territorial dispute between gangs. The four victims were injured.

On 20 May 2020, in San Victor village, Orange Walk district, residents attacked customs officers that were trying to arrest two men driving vehicles loaded with contraband. The villagers attacked the officers with stones and made them retreat before being injured. [size=no report]

On 14 May 2020, in Belize City, a stevedore activist and some members of the Federation of Cruise Tourism Association of Belize FECTAB demonstrated against Lord Michael Ashcroft in front of TV Channel 5 building. Ashcroft was presenting a proposal to government to invest in a cruise tourism port on lands owned by the Port of Belize Limited. The police arrested 5 of the demonstrators for violating the State of emergency regulations to prevent coronavirus infections. [size=no report]
On 3 May 2020, in Dangriga, Stann Creek, two men were shot by an armed man. According to the police, the attack is gang related. No fatalities were reported.
On 27 April 2020, in Hattieville, Belize District, three men intercepted and shot dead a man. 1 fatality.

On 19 April 2020, in Willows Bank village, Belize District, a man was found dead in his home, after having being detained and beaten by the police for violating the State of Emergency curfew ordered to prevent coronavirus infection. The victim, a fashion designer, was detained twice since the beginning of the curfew for the same reason, and was alleguedly brutalized by the police for being gay. 1 fatality.

On 17 April 2020, in Belize City, gang members signed a peace agreement and handed over 22 guns, including AK-47 assault rifles after a mediation led by the police in a prison. The people involved in the agreement were released from prison, where they were detained as part of a State of Emergency initiative that was launched by Government in March.
On 17 April 2020, in Belize City, the Majestic Alley gang clashed with a rival gang. Police intervened and fired shots to disperse them. No fatalities reported.

On 4 April 2020, in Belmopan, Cayo District, three men were beaten (and allegedly shot) by police officers that were controlling the curfew imposed by the government to prevent coronavirus transmission. One of the victims of the attack was arrested and another one was severely injured. The Police Commissioner condemned the brutality of the procedure and ordered an immediate investigation.

On 21 March 2020, in Belize, the government closed the country's borders to prevent coronavirus. Also all bars, clubs, lounges, and casinos countrywide were ordered to close. On 25 March, a curfew was established requiring that children below 16 years to remain indoors from 6:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m On 26 March the government declared quarantine in the country to control coronavirus pandemic, i.a. restricting the movement of people and the size of public gatherings to 10 persons or less.

On 18 March 2020, in Belize City, Police forces arrested at least 82 people from 8 zones of the city, during an operation against gang violence. The operation is part of the meassures of the State of Emergency declared after a wave of gang violence during the past days.
On 17 March 2020, in Belize City, four delivery men were shot by two armed men. One man died and three people were injured. 1 fatality.

On 17 March 2020, in Belize City, the government of Belize declared the State of Emergency to respond to an alarming increase of gang violence. Military and Police Forces were deployed in 8 zones of the city. The security forces will conduct 'comprehensive searches and operations' in those areas. On 9 April the government took additional measures to restrict the operation of construction businesses all around the country. On 17 April a new amendment began, prohibiting children under 16 years to be on the streets after 4:00 p.m.; ordering medical staff to work at one facility only; and allowing utility companies to open their doors on Fridays for payment of bills.
On 16 March 2020, in Belize City, a man was shot dead by an armed man who called him out of his house. The attack is part of gang rivalry for territory. 1 fatality.

On 13 March 2020, in Valley of Peace, Belmopan, Cayo District, farmers demonstrated by blocking the road. The protesters claim the Ministry of Natural Resources is selling off lands that they have been cultivating for more than 20 years. The demonstrators also said that water for irrigation has been blocked off, and also road access to their lands. [size=no report]
On 13 March 2020, in Belize City, an armed member of a gang broke into a house and shot dead a rival gang member. 1 fatality.
On 13 March 2020, in Punta Gorda, Toledo District, a sailor of Belize Coast Guard was shot by unknown attackers.
On 6 March 2020, in Belize City, two armed men shot two men in front of a shop. One of the victims died and the other was seriously injured.

On 2 March 2020, in Belize City, members of the Christian Workers Union protested in the Port of Belize against measures taken by Port of Belize Ltd. that will leave unemployed a third of the workers and a reduction of 40% on their salaries. [size=no report]
On 1 March 2020, in San Ignacio, Cayo District, a cashier, a security guard and a store manager were shot by unidentified perpetrators. Two of the victims died and the third one was injured.
On 29 February 2020, in San Ignacio, Cayo District, a cashier and a security guard were shot dead from long distance. A third man was injured. A soldier was arrested as suspected perpetrator.
On 29 February 2020, in Belize City, a group of men approached a man and stabbed him. The victim was injured.
On 28 February 2020, in Belize City, two young men shot another two men. The victims were injured.

On 27 February 2020, in Belize City, in Highway Belize, Police and Military Forces found and confiscated an airplane with around 2 tons of cocaine. The crew managed to escape. This is the biggest cocaine cargo ever confiscated in Belize history.
On 22 February 2020, in Belize City, two men driving a motorcycle shot dead a man and injured two more men.
On 22 February 2020, in Belize City, two men driving a motorcycle shot dead a man and injured a woman. The target of the attack was the man, while the woman was passing by.
NTUCB: National Trade Union Congress of Belize; Labour Group (Belize); Teachers (Belize); PUP: People's United Party

On 22 February 2020, in Belize City, thousands of union members led by the National Trade Union Congress of Belize (NTUCB), teachers, some parliamentarians and members of the Opposition People_ United Party (PUP) marched to demonstrate against corruption. The march culminated with a rally at the Memorial Park. [size=thousands]
On 21 February 2020, in Belize City, a member of Crips Gang was shot dead by an armed man.
On 17 February 2020, in Belize City, a man driving a motorcycle shot a soldier riding a bike. The soldier was injured but survived, while the perpetrator escaped.

On 16 February 2020, in Belize City, an armed man shot a group of people in a gang-related shooting, killing a 17-year-old girl and injuring a woman and a man. According to the police, the attack is related to gang rivalry.

On 6 February 2020, in the Toledo municipality, Toledo, a destroyed plane suspected to have been used for drug trafficking was found by the Police in the Monkey River area together with magazines and bullets in boxes.

On 5 February 2020, in Benque del Viejo, Cayo, an unknown shooter from the Guatemalan side of the border shot multiple times at the Customs and Immigration building on the Belize side of the border. No injuries.
On 29 January 2020, in Belize City, a policeman was shot by unidentified men driving a SUV. The agent was driving a motorcycle following the SUV, when someone shot him from inside the vehicle.
On 26 January 2020, in rural area of Toledo District, Police Forces of Belize found and seized a crashed and burnt airplane used to transport drugs.

On 24 January 2020, in Dangriga, Stann Creek, two men riding bikes shot dead a businessman in his store. According to witnesses one of the perpetrators entered the store and shot the owner without any previous interaction.
On 22 January 2020, in Independence, Stann Creek, a man was shot and killed on his veranda over a drug deal gone bad. The victim died a week later from the injuries, the assailant was arrested.

On 22 January 2020, in rural area of Belize district, police seized an airplane transporting drugs. The airplane was on its way from Venezuela to Mexico, but landed in Belize because Mexican authorities were aware of the flight. The traffickers managed to take away the cargo and disappear.
On 11 January 2020, in Ladyville, Belize District, two men shot a man. The victim was injured in his face.

On 1 January 2020, in Belmopan, Belmopan district, a policeman was attacked by several men with machetes. The attackers escaped when the police reinforcements arrived to support their colleague. The victim was seriously injured.

On 21 December 2019, in a highway 3,5 miles away from Belize City, five men beat a man and tried to kill him. Attackers and victim were friends and the beating began when the victim was accused of stealing money from the attackers. The police saved the victim from his attackers and arrested the perpetrators. [size=5]
On 16 December 2019, in Sarteneja, Corozal District, Police Forces of Belize seized a burnt airplane that landed in an airstrip.
On 13 December 2019, in Hattieville, Belize District, two unidentified men killed a man in front of his house.

On 13 December 2019, in Guinea Grass, Orange Walk district, inhabitants caught two out of three men that robbed a store. The thieves were using camouflage clothes and had a 9 mm pistol. The inhabitants beat them and handed them over to the police. [size=no report]
On 12 December 2019, in Santa Cruz, Dangriga, Stann Creek, inhabitants protested against the new Water Board. [size=no report]
On 6 December 2019, in Corozal District, an airstrip and a burnt narco plane were seized by the police.

On 5 December 2019, nearby the border with Guatemala, in Belmopan area, the body of a teacher was found headless. The victim was missing since last week during a trip to Melchor de Mencos, at the Guatemalan border.

On 4 December 2019, in the Port of Belize, Belize City, the decomposed body of a fisherman was found near the coastline. The corpse had his hands tied behind his back, and cement blocks tied to the feet and body. According to the report this is the twelfth body found in the area in similar circumstances, the victims were always fishermen and seamen.
On 4 December 2019, in the outskirts of Belize City, on Phillip Goldson Highway, two men driving a motorcycle were shot dead by at least two armed men driving a SUV vehicle. One of the victims died.
On 26 November 2019, in Belize City, three unidentified men abducted a man, took him to a different area and shot him. The victim was seriously injured.

On 23 November 2019, in Belize City, a Chinese businessman was ambushed by four men and shot dead. The perpetrators escaped in the victim's car but were intercepted by the police. Three men were arrested.
On 21 November 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot dead by a hitman. According to the authorities, the crime is related to gang rivalry.
On 21 November 2019, in Belize City, a hitman shot a security guard. The victim was seriously injured.
On 20 November 2019, in Dangriga, Stann Creek District, two armed men shot dead a man.
On 11 November 2019, in Belize City, a member of a gang was shot dead by an unidentified men.
On 28 October 2019, in Belmopan, Belize District, a man was found beheaded hours after he left a discotheque. His head was found hours later wrapped in a plastic bag.
On 27 October 2019, in Belmopan, Cayo, authorities found a beheaded man. The head was found in a separate location, the same day. 1 fatality.

On 25 October 2019, in Gales Point Manatee, Belize District, an armed man shot dead a fisherman. The victim was know by the police because he had a criminal record related to robbery, handling stolen goods, keeping a prohibited firearm and keeping ammunition without a license.
On 23 October 2019, a man that was conducting a transaction was shot dead. The attacker and the man who was dealing with the victim escaped in a vehicle.
On 22 October 2019, in Belize City, a member of a gang was found dead with multiple bullet injuries.

On 21 October 2019, in Orange Walk district, National Security Forces of Belize seized an airplane that was used to transport drugs. The plane was left behind by their crew, and the cargo was taken away before the authorities arrived.

On 8 October 2019, in Belize City, three men were shot by a man passing by in a taxi with the windows lowered. One victim was killed and two were injured. There are elements for the police to consider the attack is gang related.

On 6 October 2019, in Santa Elena, Cayo District, a man was attacked by five men driving a SUV who forced him in, stabbed him multiple times and threw him to the road. The victim was taken to a hospital.
On 5 October 2019, in Belize City, an armed man shot in the face a private security guard who was in his security booth in a high school. The victim is in critical condition.
On 3 October 2019, in Belize City, three men were shot by unidentified men driving a taxi. The three victims were injured but survived.
On 30 September 2019, in Blue Creek, Orange Walk District, Police Forces of Belize seized an airplane that crash landed with drugs. No arrests were reported.
On 29 September 2019, in Belize City, a football player, involved in criminal activities, was shot dead by two men who broke into a party in a house.
On 19 September 2019, in Santa Elena, Cayo District, two armed men driving a motorcycle shot a group of three people, injuring a man and killing a woman.

On 18 September 2019, in Santa Elena, Cayo, one woman was shot and killed by an armed man who was, together with an accomplice on a motorbike, chasing her son. Further, another person was shot and injured in the same event. 1 fatality, 1 wounded.
On 14 September 2019, in Belmopan, two underage men were shot dead by an armed man. According to the source the attack was gang related.
Unidentified Armed Group (Ecuador); Unidentified Armed Group (Honduras)

On 8 September 2019, in Belize District, Police and Military Forces of Belize clashed with armed men during an operation that resulted in the seizure of an airplane and 1,341 kilos of cocaine, and the arrest of six foreign citizens. Two of the men arrested were injured during the shooting, and taken to hospital. The men arrested are from Mexico, Honduras and Ecuador.

On 7 September 2019, in Orange Walk District, a 13-year-old boy was missing. Four days later, his corpse was found in a sugar cane field. Three alleged murderers were arrested, one of them was the one who told the police where they had left the body. The Police is investigating if the homicide is drug related.
On 31 August 2019, in Belize City, Belize, a hitman shot dead a man when the victim was arriving home. The perpetrator escaped in a car that was waiting for him.
On 26 August 2019, in Santa Elena, Cayo District, a 18-year-old man was injured by a man who shot him and fled in a car that was waiting for him.

On 25 August 2019, in Santa Elena, Cayo District, a man broke into a house, shot dead a man, injured his 12-year-old daughter and ran away. The girl survived the attack. Two men have been detained by the police during the investigation. The victim had been involved in drugs related legal cases.
On 19 August 2019, in Hattieville, Belize District, two men shot dead a security guard while the victim was in a bus stop on his way to work.
On 17 August 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot in the head and died on the spot. According to reports, this event is related to gang rivalry. 1 fatality.

On the week from 12 to 18 August 2019, in Dangriga, Stann Creek, health workers of the Dangriga Polyclinic demonstrated through a sick-out, in a protest against a deduction in their bonuses. [size=no report]
On 16 August, 2019, in southern Belize, health workers of a polyclinic demonstrated through a sick-out, in a protest against a deduction in their bonuses. [size=no report]
On 8 August 2019, in Belize City, eight unsatisfied inmates rioted in a demonstration against their treatment at the Kolbe Foundation-managed prison. [size=8]
On 8 August 2019, in Belize City, an unidentified man shot dead a dockworker. The victim was a gang member.

On 7 August 2019, in Belize City, a member of Rocky Road Gang was shot dead by unidentified perpetrators. The police is investigating whether the perpetrators are members of Rocky Road Gang or a rival gang.

On August 01 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot several times by unidentified armed men. The victim was injured and taken to hospital, where he is recovering. The attack is reportedly related to a debt. 1 casualty.
On 26 July 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot and injured by two armed men while walking down the street. According to reports, this event is related to gang rivalry.

On July 17 2019, on Cemetery Road (Belize City), a shop owner was shot dead in his own store by unidentified armed men. The reason for the murder is unknown and there is no information regarding the identity of the perpetrator. 1 fatality.

On 16 July 2019, in the North Side of Belize City, a taxi driver was shot and killed. The victim's car had run into a drain and flipped on its side, inside was the dead driver. According to the report, two men were seen exiting the car moments prior to its running into a drain. 1 fatality.

On July 16 2019, in Belize City, the police chased an individual and shot. The individual was shot and crashed his car at the foot of the Swing Bridge in Downtown Belize City. He was then taken to hospital by the police, but died a few days later. 1 fatality.

On July 15 2019, in Sandhill, Belize District, the mutilated body of a teenager was found floating in a lagoon. The body had been missing since July 9. The reasons for the murder are unknown, however, the police said there are two rivalling groups in the city and the victim belonged to one of said groups. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2019, in Belize City (Belize), 2 brothers were killed by unidentified armed actors. The motive and perpetrators behind the killing are still unknown, but the police forces have not discounted the involvement of gang members.

On 23 June 2019, in the San Pedro lagoon, in San Pedro locality (Belize), a local tour guide and a tourist from the United States were shot dead by unidentified armed actors. The previous week, unidentified armed actors shot against the house of the tour guide, after he was involved in a dispute with a local gang member.
On 21 June 2019, in Corozal Town (Corozal), a man was shot dead by two masked unidentified armed men. The motive and perpetrators behind the killing are still unknown.

Between 18-20 June 2019, in Swallow Caye, 3 miles of the coast of Belize City (Belize), 5 men who were fishing in the area were shot dead by unidentified armed actors and thrown to the ocean. Their decomposing bodies were found between Thursday, Friday and Saturday. The motive and perpetrators behind the killings are still unknown, but the police forces have not discounted the involvement of sea pirates or drug traffickers (due to a so-called wet drop in the area).

On 15 June 2019, in Belize City (Belize), a police officer was abducted by 2 unidentified armed actors dressed in police uniforms. He was released later in the day. It is unclear whether the police officer was off-duty or not.
On 13 June 2019, in Corozal Town (Corozal, Belize), a person was locked in the trunk of his car and taken somewhere else by unidentified armed actors. The person managed to escape.

On 7 June 2019, in Belize City (Belize), inhabitants from the Belama Phase 4 area staged a protest in front of the Fen Lan Company facilities against their eviction. The owner of the company is the alleged owner of the lands where the protesters inhabit and from which they are threatened with being evicted. The protest didn't have the permit from the Belize Police Department. The police forces intervened and dispersed the protest. [size=no report]

On 5 June 2019, in Belmopan city (Cayo), teachers and students from the Belmopan Comprehensive High School staged a protest against the school's board, which allowed 17 students who, according to the teachers, didn't meet the academic criteria to graduate, to do so. Protesters sung the national anthem and the school's song. [size=no report]

On 4 June 2019, in Belize City (Belize), 3 people (2 females and 1 male) were shot dead by unidentified armed actors. The motive and perpetrators behind the killing are still unknown, but the police forces have not discounted the possible link of the event to the fact that one of the victims, who was the acting principal at the Excelsior High School, was about to testify on Thursday regarding the alleged misappropriation of funds from the school.

On 3 June 2019, in Belmopan city (Cayo), teachers from the Belmopan Comprehensive High School started a sit-in protest against the school's board, which allowed 17 students who, according to the teachers, didn't meet the academic criteria to graduate, to do so. [size=no report]

On 23 May 2019, students, teachers and staff from the St. Luke Methodist school took to the streets in Belize City (Belize) to protest against the shooting of one of their students, who resulted severely injured after an attack at a supermarket on Central American Boulevard by unidentified armed actors. Protesters marched from the school to the junction of Pen Road and Central American Boulevard. [size=no report]
PSU: Public Service Union; Labour Group (Belize)

On 21 May 2019, around 50 affiliates to PSU staged a protest in front of the Belmopan City Hall in Belmopan city (Cayo) against the 'secret' sale by the city mayor of the Hill Top property, building that serves as the headquarters of the PSU. [size=50]

On 19 May 2019, 2 men were shot and injured by 2 unidentified armed actors on a motorcycle in Raccoon Street Extension, Belize City (Belize). The motive and perpetrators behind the attack are still unknown.

On 19 May 2019, a man was shot and injured by an unidentified armed actor while driving along Baymen Avenue, in Belize City (Belize). His wife, who also was in the car, was unharmed. The police forces believe that the attack is linked to feuds between groups in the area.

On 18 May 2019, a man was shot dead by an unidentified armed actor on Fabers Road Extension, Belize City (Belize). The police forces believe that the killing is linked to feuds between groups in the area.

On 17 May 2019, 2 men were shot and injured by an unidentified armed actor in the Belama sector, Belize City (Belize). The police forces believe that the shooting is linked to feuds between groups in the area.
On 3 May 2019, in Belize City, 13 people demonstrated peacefully demanding a lower cost rent, education, gas prices, and healthcare. According to reports, more people joined in later. [size=13]

On May 01 2019, in Belize City, an off-duty volunteer soldier was attacked by an unknown armed person. It is reported that the soldier, who was with a friend, was killed. There is no information about the perpetrator or the reason for the attack.
On 13 April 2019, in Ladyville, a police officer shot and injured one man, who, together with an accomplice, attacked him and his partner. 1 wounded.
On 11 April 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot several times and killed while leaving his house. According to reports, his murder is a result of gang rivalry in the area. 1 fatality.

On 8 April 2019, in San Ignacio, Cayo, a man was shot and killed inside his home. According to reports, moments before the attack, three men arrived in the victims house and opened fire after a brief conversation. 1 fatality.
On March 27 2019, in Belize City, two armed individuals attacked two men inside a house. The reasons for the attack are reported to be related to drug trafficking. No further specifications.

On 8 March 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot and injured while walking down the street with a group of men. According to reports, the group of men was approached by two men on motorbikes and shot right after, leaving one man wounded. 1 injured.

On March 08 2019, in Sarstoon River, near Crique Sarco, Guatemalan Navy allegedly opened fire on three Belize flag boats who according to them were in Guatemala's territorial waters. The Minister of National Security of Belize was on a tour in one of this boat. No injuries are reported.
On 3 March 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot and injured by two men who entered his home. 1 injured.
On 6 February 2019, in Belize City, a police officer was shot and injured following a clash between two police officers and two men on a motorcycle. 1 injured.

On 28 January 2019, in Belize City, a man was shot several times by two men in dark clothing, while dropping off his girlfriend at her house. According to reports, he was the son of a local magnate. 1 fatality.

On 3 January 2019, in Belize City, two men were attacked with a gun by two other men who approached them in the street. According to reports, one of the attackers was shot and wounded by the father of one of the victims. 1 injured.

On 2 January 2019, in Belize City, authorities found a dead body floating in the river. According to reports, the dead body was hand-tied behind his back and in an advanced state of decomposition. 1 fatality.
On 2 January 2019, In Belize City, a man riding a motorbike was shot and killed by two other men, riding next to him, on two different motorbikes. 1 fatality.
On 1 January 2019, in Belize City, authorities found a community activist, shot dead. According to reports, he had a significant influence on a local gang. 1 fatality.
On 1 January 2019, in Belize City, the head of the Crisps Gang was killed in the street by an unknown armed man. 1 fatality.

On 25 December 2018, in Orange Walk town, Orange Walk District, an armed man driving a motorcycle shot two men socializing in a house on Muffles Street (drive-by). The victims were injured. According to the authorities, the attack is gang related.
On 22 December 2018, in Belmopan, Cayo, an off-duty police officer, and his wife were attacked by two masked men. The police officer was shot dead and his wife was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

On 20 December 2018, on the road from Crique Jute to San Antonio, in the Toledo District, two armed men ambushed a police officer who was off-duty and accompanied by his wife. The officer died and the woman was injured. The police arrested three men in connection to the attack. 1 fatality.

On 20 December 2018, three miles away from Barranco Village, Toledo District, police forces found and seized a clandestine airplane used for drug trafficking. The police arrested three police officers and a civilian who were caught in the area transporting gasoline and an airplane seat. No cargo was found in the plane.

On 13 December 2018, in Santa Elena, Cayo district, two women were shot by two men in Bishop Martin High School Street. One of the victims died and the other was injured. Several kids were with the victims but none of them resulted injured. 1 fatality.

On 9 December 2018, in Belize City, a man shot several police officers who were checking the neighbourhood after hearing a shooting, in Mayflower area. The policemen shot back, but the perpetrator escaped. A day later the police arrested a suspected perpetrator of the shooting. No victims were reported.

On 7 December 2018, in Belize City, a man was shot dead during a fight between rival gangs in a bar located in Newton Barracks. Police officers were trying to intervened in the clash when the perpetrator shot his victim. No arrests were reported. 1 fatality.

On 6 December 2018, in Belize City, an armed man along with a getaway car driver shot dead a man at the intersection of Handyside and Queen Streets. According to the report, the perpetrators were looking for a member of the Majestic Alley's gang, and shot dead a civilian by mistake. 1 fatality.
Around 25 November 2018 (as reported), in Benque Viejo del Carmen, Cayo District, a Guatemalan citizen was executed with a shot to the back of the neck and another to the chest . 1 fatality.
On 23 November 2018, teachers in one school in Benque Viejo el Carmen protested due to the timeliness of salaries being paid and an attempt to dismiss one teacher [size=no report].

On 18 November 2018, in Belize City, armed men shot and killed a man at the corner of the George Price Highway and Krooman Road. Two vehicles were seen escpaing the scene, a car and a motorcycle, after the attack. 1 fatality.

On 9 November 2018, in Belmopan, Cayo District, members of the Belize National Teachers Union BNTU arrived in 20 buses from all over the country and marched in a protest to demand several labour rights contemplated in the so called Proposal 22. The demands include an improvement of their salaries and better working environments. [size=no report]

On 7 November 2018, in Belize City, two men driving a motorcycle intercepted a car, one of them got off and shot and injured the driver, in Neal's Pen Road. One man was arrested days later as a suspected perpetrator.

On 7 November 2018, in Belmopan, Cayo District, members of the Belize National Teachers Union BNTU demonstrated against Proposal 22 and other labour conditions that are being negotiated with the government. [size=no report]
On 26 October 2018, a group of health workers gathered outside a hospital located in Dangriga to call the attention of the Ministry of Health following allegations of negligence [size=no report].

On 21 October 2018, in Belize City, two men driving a car arrived at a house and shot a man in Casuarina Street. The victim was injured, and the perpetrators were arrested later on. In another incident, two men driving a motorcycle were intercepted by at least two armed men in a car that hit them. An armed men went out of the car and shot and injured one of the victims while the other ran away, on the Philip Goldson Highway. No fatalities reported.

Around 14 October 2018 (between 11 - 18 October), in Belize City municipality, a woman was killed, chopped and thrown in a distant area in the middle of the bush, nearby Coastal Road. She was missing since 11 October and her corpse was found on 18 October. 1 fatality.
On 11 October 2018, in San Pedro Town, Belize, two masked men shot dead a man and injured his brother in a bar.

On 11 October 2018, in Orange Walk Town, Orange Walk District, an armed man shot a woman and a man. The perpetrator was picked up by a getaway car. The woman was injured and the man was killed. The attack has been related to an internal war within the Back-a-Town Gang. 1 fatality.
On 3 October 2018, in Belize City, 64 prisoners, allegedly gang members, were released after 30 days of imprisonment permitted by the State of Emergency implemented in two areas of the city.

On 3 October 2018, in Belize City, ten inmates of the Princess Royal Youth Hostel demonstrated by breaking through the sheetrock ceiling and ending up on top of the roof of one of the buildings. The demonstrators asked for better conditions and treatment. [size=no report]
On 2 October 2018, 10 women in Belize City protested on the roof of a female inmates residence after additional protocols were put in place to provide educational classes [size=10].

On 30 September 2018, in Orange Walk Town, Orange Walk District, two men driving a motorcycle shot two men in a drive-by shooting on Muffles Street. One of the victims died and the other was injured. The police think the crimes are gang-related.
On 27 September 2018, in San Pedro, Belize district, three men stabbed dead a man in a hotel room. 1 fatality.

On 21 September 2018, in Santa Helena, Cayo district, two men driving a motorcycle shot six people, in Hot Point area (drive-by). One man was severely injured. The attack has been described as part of an incident between two groups without referring to armed ones.
Unidentified Gang (Mexico); Police Forces of Belize (2008-2020)

On 9 September 2018, in Blumenthal, Orange Walk District, armed men clashed with a joint team of police and military forces during an operation to seize an illegal airplane. After a prolonged shooting, the military and police forces seized the airplane and a pick-up vehicle, both of them with cocaine cargo. The pilot managed to escape, but two Mexican men, a Belizean civilian and two police officers were arrested.

On 9 September 2018, in Blue Creek, Orange Walk district, Police and military forces seized a drug airplane with a cocaine cargo valued in US 7 million. Five people were arrested, including two police officers and two Mexican citizens.
On 8 September 2018, in Belize City, an armed man shot dead a Southside Gang member in the corner of Baldwin Drive and Neal Penn Road. The attack was described as a gang shooting. 1 fatality.

On 5 September 2018, in Belize City, the Governor General of Belize declared the State of Emergency in the Southside of the city. The State of Emergency have been declared in order to control an increase of violence between gangs in two areas of the Southside.

On 4 September 2018, in Belize City, Belize, 100 gang members from Ghost Town Gang and George Street Gaza Gang were arrested by military forces under the State of Public Emergency declared by the government the day before to control gang violence in Southside Belize.

On 1 September 2018, in Belize City, gang rivalry produced attacks that ended in three people killed. The Government declared the ''State of Emergency'' four days later, because between Friday and Saturday six people died in armed attacks: ''the most killingous weekend in Belizean history ''.
On 31 August 2018, in Belize City, Belize, an armed man shot dead a man in a gang related attack. Also in Belize City, three people were killed in attacks related to gang rivalry. 4 fatalities.

On 19 August 2018, in Orange Walk Town, Orange Walk district, two masked men jumped out of a vehicle and shot four men, outside the Louisiana Football Field. Two of the victims were killed. According to the report, the attack was perpetrated by gang members and one of the victims was the Crips Gang's leader. 2 fatalities
On 2 August 2018, in Belmopan, Cayo district, over 20 City Council employees demonstrated to demand the payment of their salaries. [size=over 20]

On 28 July 2018, in Belize City, a man was shot dead by an unidentified man. The victim was recovering from a previous attack occurred in April. According to the police, the crime may be related to gang retaliation.

On 28 July 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a PIV gang member was intercepted and shot dead by a man. Allegedly, the attack could be related to the fact that the victim had moved to a different neighborhood controlled by the Gungulungs gang. 1 fatality.

On 27 July 2018, in Belize City, an armed man broke into a yard and shot a group of friends in Berry Street. One man, who allegedly was a member of a gang was killed. According to the report, the attack is thought to be an internal purge in the neighbour's gang. 1 fatality.
On 20 July 2018, in Punta Gorda, Toledo District, two hooded men shot several times at a woman, injuring her. The police arrested two suspected perpetrators.
On 19 July 2018, in Belize City, an unidentified man shot dead a man from a motorcycle.

On 18 July 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two armed men riding two bikes shot a woman and her daughter in Kraal Road. According to the report, the attack is related to gang rivalry. The victims were injured.
On 9 July 2018, in Belize City, an armed men shot dead a construction worker. According to some neighbours the crime may be related to gangs rivalry.
On 6 July 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a man was shot dead by an armed man in Wagners Lane. There are allegations that the victim was a member of Jump Street gang. 1 fatality.
On 5 July 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a Jump Street Gang member ambushed and shot dead a man that refused to join the gang. 1 fatality.
On 2 July 2018, in Hope Creek village, Stann Creek district, several young members of a gang stabbed and injured a 16-year-old man. One 15-year-old man was arrested as suspected perpetrator.

On 26 June 2018, in Belmopan, Cayo, demonstrators protested opposing the training that Israeli police have begun with the Belize Police Forces. Most of the demonstrators were artists, students and teachers, and are concerned about Israel's human rights abuses. [size=no report]

On 26 June 2018, in Trial Farm, Orange Walk District, four people were shot by a man inside a house. All the victims were injured. According to the report, the attack is related to a turf war between gangs.

Around 19 June 2018, in Otoxcha village, Toledo, Military Forces of Belize started patrolling to prevent incursions from Guatemala. Since April Guatemalan farmers have been making aggressive incursions into Belize to clear lands to make plantations. The Guatemalans farmers also have threatened the population.

On 9 June 2018, in Hattieville village, Belize district, a man was shot dead, in Peter Lewis Street. According to the report, the victim of the attack had criminal record related to drug trafficking. 1 fatality.
On 9 June 2018, in Belize City, a police agent was shot and injured in Victoria street. Two persons are being sought as suspected perpetrators.

On 2 June 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a police officer shot a 13-year-old boy after chasing him. The victim was injured. According to the authorities, the boy was armed, this information was denied by the victim's parents.
On 21 May 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men riding bikes shot a man in a fish shop. The target was not injured, but a customer was killed and an employee was injured. 1 fatality.
On 21 May 2018, an armed man shot dead a taxi driver. Two days later, the perpetrator was arrested and said that the victim was a member of a rival gang.

On 14 May 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a group of supporters of the San Pedro United Democratic Party (UDP) demonstrated in front of the Supreme Court demanding the running of a new election due to the registering of several discrepancies in the vote counting process. [size=no report]
On 14 May 2018, in Belmopan, unidentified armed men shot the house of the mayor and his girlfriend's car, which was parked in front of the house.

On 13 May 2018, in Cayo Rosario, Corozal District, which is off the coast from Ambergris Caye (coded at San Pedro) tour guides and operators, concerned citizens, and activists gathered in boats to protest against a development project that involves the building of over-the-water structures at Cayo Rosario. [size=no report]
On 12 May 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a 6-year-old boy was injured as a collateral victim of a clash between gangs in Central America Boulevard. A 16-year-old gang member was arrested.
On 3 May 2018, in Belize City, Belize, an armed man shot dead a marijuana seller in what authorities consider is an attack related to gang war in Central American Boulevard. 1 fatality.
On 2 May 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men riding bikes shot and injured four people outside a Chinese store on Fabers Road. According to the authorities the attack is related to gang rivalry.

On 26 April 2018, in San Pedro, Belize district, two men broke into a store and shot dead the owner, a Honduran citizen, in San Mateo area. A minor was arrested accused of being one of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.
On 25 April 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men riding bikes shot dead a man. 1 fatality.

On 24 April 2018, in San Estevan, Orange Walk district, police forces found and seized a clandestine airplane that landed on the San Estevan/Progresso Road. The airplane had signs of a burning attempt and of having been used to transport drugs.

On 24 April 2018, in Belmopan City, Cayo district, between 20 and 30 members of the Garifuna indigenous group demonstrated in a protest against the refusal of the Forestry Department to grant them concession licenses for logging in their village of Baranco. [size=between 20 and 30]

On 28 March 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men broke into a yard in Neal Penn Road and shot a family, killing a man and injuring a baby. The police officers have not confirmed if the attack was perpetrated by one or two men. 1 fatality.

On 28 March 2018, in Belize City, Belize, three men were shot by a man in Ebony Street. One of the victims was killed and the others resulted unharmed. According to the authorities, the attack is gang related. One man was arrested. 1 fatality.

On 24 March 2018, in Belize City, an unidentified armed man shot a group of men killing one of them. According to the police, the shooting was due to gang rivalry, and the victim was not the intended target, but was socializing with him.
On 23 March 2018, in Belmopan City, the Belize National Teachers Union (BNTU) held a protest against violence against women and children. [size=no report]
On 22 March 2018, in Belmopan City, Cayo district, hundreds of teachers members of the Belize National Teachers Union demonstrated in an anti-crime rally. [size=hundreds]

Around 20 March 2018 (as reported), in Roaring Creek, Cayo district, a man was tortured and killed, and the house he was living in was burned down. He was missing since 17 March and his body was found floating in a river on 20 March. 1 fatality.

On 18 March 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men were shot by an armed man at the corner of Fairweather Street and South Creek. One of the victims, a private security guard off-duty, was killed. According to the report, the intended target was the unharmed man and the attack was related to gang rivalry. 1 fatality.
On 17 March 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men driving a motorcycle intercepted a man and shot him in Gibnut Street. The victim was injured.

On 17 March 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men shot three women and a man, in Rock Stone Pond area. Two women were killed and the other woman and the man were injured. A suspected perpetrator was arrested. 2 fatalities.
On 17 March 2018, in Belize City, two members of Ghost Crips Gang clashed in a shooting with armed men on Mahogany Street. The leader of Crips gang was killed and his partner was injured. 1 fatality.
On 16 March 2018, in Belize City, thousands of women demonstrated in the ''Strong Women Rally'', asking for women rights and progress. [size=20,000]

Around 10 March 2018 (as reported), some miles away from Paraiso village, Corozal district, a man was found mutilated nearby San Jomal Road. The victim was killed somewhere else, and his perpetrators took his remains to the location. 1 fatality.
On 6 March 2018, in San Pedro Town, Belize, demonstrators organized a candlelight vigil at the Central Park as a protest against abuse, crime and violence against children. [size=no report]
On 3 March 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two armed men intercepted a man driving a vehicle and shot him in Yorke Street. The victim was injured.
On 2 March 2018, in San Pedro Town, Belize, protesters marched in a demonstration against abuse, crime and violence against children. [size=no report]
On 26 February 2018, in Santa Cruz, Corozal district, police forces seized an illegal airplane used for drug trafficking.
On 26 February 2018, in rural area of Orange Walk district, police forces seized an illegal airplane strip used for drug trafficking. The plane was found burnt.
On 26 February 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men driving a motorcycle intercepted and shot a man (drive-by). The victim was injured.

On 21 February 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a member of a gang shot dead a 12-year-old boy. According to the police the attack is part of a war between George Street Gang (GSG) and the Taylor's Alley Gang. 1 fatality.

On 17 February 2018, in Belize city, Police officers attacked four men that were in a van. The police first shot the van injuring one of the passengers, and then hit two of them. According to the report the victims had not committed any crime.
On 12 February 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men driving a motorcycle shot dead a man in Queen Charlotte area. 1 fatality.
On 9 February 2018, in Belize City, Belize, an armed man killed an alleged gang member in front of the Michael Finnegan Market. The attack seems to be gang-related.

Around 4 February 2018 (month of), in Harmonyville, Cayo District, a man was killed and his body was found in an advanced stage of decomposition with his hand and feet tied and a plastic bag on his head and stab wounds. The victim was reported missing. 1 fatality.
On 24 January 2018, in Belize City, three men shot dead a man near Bishop Street. According to reports, the attack was related to gang rivalry. 1 fatality.

On 23 January 2018, in San Pedro Town, Belize district, two armed men shot two men on Crocodile Street. One victim was killed and the other was injured. According to the authorities the attack is a result of the gang rivalry taking place in San Pedro. 1 fatality.

On 23 January 2018, in Ladyville, Belize District, two armed men shot a group of people on Marage Road, Japan area. Two victims were killed and two were injured. Two men were arrested as suspected perpetrators. 2 fatalities.
On 23 January 2018, in Roaring Creek, Cayo District, two armed men shot a man and a woman. The man was killed and the woman injured. Two men were arrested as suspected perpetrators. 1 fatality.
On 23 January 2018, in San Pedro, Ambergris Caye, Belize, unidentified armed men shot two cousins, killing one of them and injuring the other one. The victim was a gang leader.

On 16 January 2018, a journalist that was taking pictures in the Belize side of the border with Guatemala reported that he was assaulted by Belize police officers that demanded him to go to the Guatemalan custom point.

On 17 January 2018, in Belize City, Belize, an alleged member of a gang was ambushed and shot dead near his workplace on Kelly street. According to the authorities the attack is a result of gang tensions. 1 fatality.
On 14 January 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two men driving a motorcycle shot a group of men on Armadillo Street. Two of the victims were injured.
On 13 January 2018, in Dangriga, Stann Creek, a policeman shot dead a civilian. According to eyewitnesses the victim was unarmed and killed in cold blood.

On 4 January 2018, in Belize City, an unidentified armed man shot a man that was not his target. Presumably the target was one of the victim's sons, members of two different gangs, and the attack is part of a gang clash. The victim is in critical conditions and the perpetrator escaped.
On 2 January 2018, in Belize City, Belize, two armed men shot dead a man and injured a woman in Belama area. 1 fatality.
On 1 January 2018, in Belize City, Belize, a group of men were attacked by around 30 armed men on Barrack Road. One man was stabbed dead. Three suspected perpetrators were arrested. 1 fatality.

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Belize with 160 reports followed by Cayo with 45 reports.
The largest admin1 is Belize with 160 reports followed by Cayo with 45 reports.
